docs.summary: The Wix CLI is a tool that allows you to work with your Wix site from your computer's terminal.
description: The CLI is an npm or yarn package that you install on your computer. Before setting up the CLI, make sure your site is [connected to GitHub](https://support.wix.com/en/article/velo-setting-up-velo-pro#connect-your-site-to-github) and your site's repository is cloned on your computer.
To install the CLI, do the following:
1. Once you've installed the CLI globally, you can use it with any Wix site repos on your computer.

docs.summary: Installs a code package to a site's repo.
description: For security reasons, you can only install [approved npm packages](https://www.wix.com/velo/npm-modules) on Wix sites.
If your site's repo has a `yarn.lock` file, the installer uses yarn to install packages by default.
Otherwise, the installer uses npm by default. To specify which package manager to use, include an `--npm` or `--yarn` options flag.

examples.title: Install a package using the CLI
body: // Once the package is installed, a message is displayed in the terminal.
